jobFunction: Human Resources, Administrative, and General Business
description:
Smartling was founded 14 years ago to make localization and translation seamless. Today, Smartling is profitable and backed by Battery Ventures, a global technology-focused investment firm, supporting company growth and expanding our market share and leadership position. We are the only cloud-based, AI-enabled translation platform that combines a Neural Machine Translation Hub and professional language services empowering teams to collaborate in real-time to create experiences customers love. The Human Resources Associate will primarily support various Human Resources/Administrative functions and manage the end-to-end recruitment process (when needed). This role requires exceptional communication skills and attention to detail. The ideal candidate will have a passion for hiring the best talent; a desire to improve any project they work on; and a curiosity to learn new skills and knowledge. You will play an integral role in up-leveling our internal People management systems and processes and supporting our employees and candidates.
**You will** Manage candidate experience: * Create a positive and memorable candidate experience from the first point of contact through onboarding to offboarding * Communicate effectively with candidates, providing timely feedback and updates * Source and engage candidates through job boards, social media, networking, and other channels * Assist in the continued development and implementation of onboarding programs. * Collaborate with hiring managers to support recruitment efforts, including job postings, candidate screening, etc Provide HR Support: * Assist in maintaining employee records and HR databases * Address employee inquiries regarding HR policies and procedures * Participate in HR projects and process improvements to enhance efficiency and effectiveness * Support Director of People Operations in various strategic initiatives and special projects across the employee lifecycle Keep up with Compliance: * Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations * Assist with employee record management, ensuring compliance with company policies and legal requirements Prepare Reporting: * Track and analyze recruitment metrics to measure the effectiveness of sourcing strategies * Provide regular HR reports * You will conduct comprehensive monthly reporting, dashboard administration, and audits to ensure compliance and support teams across the organization * Continuously improve and create processes and workflows, leveraging systems, tools, and automation
**You Have** * Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. * 2+ years of HR management and/or recruitment experience * Strong knowledge of or desire to learn labor laws and HR best practices. * Excellent communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills. * Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information. * Understanding of recruitment processes and best practices * Ability to adapt to change and demonstrate flexibility in handling various tasks
**You are** * **Proactive**. Willing to take the initiative and provide suggestions and ideas to contribute to the success of the role/team * **Analytical**. Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills * **Customer-focused**. Passionate for employee and candidate success at all times. * **Detail-oriented**. Supremely well organized with attention to detail * **A Team Player**. Ability to work effectively and cross-functionally within all levels of management, both internally and externally
**You Will Enjoy** * Freedom 🏡 - we are remote first * Growth - an opportunity to learn and advance your career * Wealth 💰 - we offer a competitive salary and 401(k) + company match * Wellness - health insurance; free medical plan for you and your family * Balance - flexible PTO + 11 holidays; generous parental leave * Culture 🤝- an energetic, value-driven, and fun culture and team spirit * Bonus - employee referral program and Apple equipment
*We are considering candidates based in Eastern and Central time zones.* *Smartling is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building an inclusive global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, skills, and experiences.* *We use the E-verify platform to verify work authorizations.* *To work from home, you must have a strong internet connection, a quiet space, and a professional (distraction and clutter-free) background.*
responsibilities:
Manage candidate experience:

* Create a positive and memorable candidate experience from the first point of contact through onboarding to offboarding
* Communicate effectively with candidates, providing timely feedback and updates
* Source and engage candidates through job boards, social media, networking, and other channels
* Assist in the continued development and implementation of onboarding programs.
* Collaborate with hiring managers to support recruitment efforts, including job postings, candidate screening, etc

Provide HR Support:

* Assist in maintaining employee records and HR databases
* Address employee inquiries regarding HR policies and procedures
* Participate in HR projects and process improvements to enhance efficiency and effectiveness
* Support Director of People Operations in various strategic initiatives and special projects across the employee lifecycle

Keep up with Compliance:

* Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations
* Assist with employee record management, ensuring compliance with company policies and legal requirements

Prepare Reporting:

* Track and analyze recruitment metrics to measure the effectiveness of sourcing strategies
* Provide regular HR reports
* You will conduct comprehensive monthly reporting, dashboard administration, and audits to ensure compliance and support teams across the organization
* Continuously improve and create processes and workflows, leveraging systems, tools, and automation

qualifications.required:
Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
* 2+ years of HR management and/or recruitment experience
* Strong knowledge of or desire to learn labor laws and HR best practices.
* Excellent communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information.
* Understanding of recruitment processes and best practices
* Ability to adapt to change and demonstrate flexibility in handling various tasks
